intro: Loxogramme antrophyoides, commonly known as the golden star fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that form a star-shaped pattern, typically with four to eight lobes. The plant thrives in slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and streams, where it can receive adequate sunlight. Its reproductive structures are submerged, and it produces tiny, yellowish flowers that are not easily visible to the naked eye. Loxogramme antrophyoides plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and small aquatic life.
